action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller-Meeks (for herself, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Meijer, Mr. Upton, Mr. Cawthorn, and Mr. Bentz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committees on Homeland Security, and Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To terminate certain contracts relating to the construction of the border fence and to transfer unused border fence material to the States along the southwest border.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Border's Unused Idle and Lying Dormant Inventory Transfer Act or the BUILD IT Act.

section.header: Transfer of unused border fence material to border States

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Federal Government shall deliver to the Governments of Arizona, California, New Mexico, and Texas, upon request, any materials associated with the construction of the barrier along international border between the United States and Mexico that—

paragraph.text: are in the possession of the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Defense, or any other Federal agency; or
have been purchased by the Federal Government, but remain in the possession of any contractor or vendor.

subsection.header: Prohibition of fees and delivery charges
subsection.text: The Federal Government may not charge any fee or other delivery charge to any of the States referred to in subsection (a) for the delivery of the materials described in subsection (a).
Any State receiving materials pursuant to subsection (a) shall use such materials for the purpose of barrier construction along the international border between the United States and Mexico.

The Federal Government shall terminate, at the convenience of the Government, any contract relating to the maintenance and security of the materials intended for the construction referred to in subsection (a) that—

paragraph.text: is in effect on the date of the enactment of this Act; and
must be terminated in order to comply with subsection (a).
